Karnataka High Court

Raveesha vs State Of Karnataka on 30 July, 2024

Author: 
S Vishwajith Shetty

Bench: 
S Vishwajith Shetty

 -1-
 NC: 2024:KHC:29916
 CRL.P No. 3155 of 2024

 IN THE HIGH COURT OF KARNATAKA AT BENGALURU

 DATED THIS THE 30TH DAY OF JULY, 2024

 BEFORE
 THE HON'BLE MR JUSTICE S VISHWAJITH SHETTY
 CRIMINAL PETITION NO. 3155 OF 2024
 BETWEEN:

 RAVEESHA,
 S/O SHIVARUDRAIAH, 32 YEARS,
 R/O BOMMANAHALLI VILLAGE,
 NITTUR HOBLI, GUBBI TALUK,
 DIST: TUMAKURU - 572 223.
 ...PETITIONER
 (BY SRI. BIKKANNAVAR SHANKAR TAMMANNA, ADVOCATE)

 AND:

 STATE OF KARNATAKA BY
 CHELUR POLICE STATION,
 GUBBI TALUK, TUMKURU DISTRICT - 572 117,
Digitally signed (REPRESENTED BY STATE PUBLIC PROSECUTOR),
by YAMUNA K HIGH COURT OF KARNATAKA,
L
 BENGALURU - 560 001.
Location: High
 ...RESPONDENT
Court of
Karnataka (BY SRI. K. NAGESHWARAPPA, HCGP)

 THIS CRL.P IS FILED U/S 439 OF CR.PC PRAYING TO
 ENLARGE THE PETITIONER ON BAIL IN CR.NO.147/2023
 REGISTERED BY CHELUR P.S., TUMAKURU FOR THE OFFENCE
 P/U/S 498A, 304B OF 
IPC
 AND SEC.3 AND 4 OF D.P ACT
 PENDING ON THE FILE OF THE PRL. CIVIL JUDGE (JR.DN) AND
 J.M.F.C COURT GUBBI TUMAKURU DISTRICT IN
 C.C.NO.27/2024.

 THIS PETITION, COMING ON FOR ORDERS, THIS DAY,
 ORDER WAS MADE THEREIN AS UNDER:
 -2-
 NC: 2024:KHC:29916
 CRL.P No. 3155 of 2024

CORAM: HON'BLE MR JUSTICE S VISHWAJITH SHETTY
 ORAL ORDER

 Accused No.1 in S.C.No.57/2024 pending before the

Court of I Additional District and Sessions Judge, Tumakuru,

arising out of Crime No.147/2023 registered by Chelur Police

Station, Tumakuru District, for the offences punishable under

Sections 498-A
, 
304-B
 of IPC and 
Sections 3
 & 
4
 of Dowry

Prohibition Act, 1961, is before this Court under 
Section 439
 of

Cr.P.C.

 2. Heard the learned counsel for the parties.

 3. F.I.R. in Crime No.147/2023 was registered by

Chelur Police Station, Tumakuru District, initially for the

offences punishable under 
Sections 143
, 
147
, 
498-A
, 
302
,

304B
, 
149
 of IPC and 
Sections 3
 & 
4
 of Dowry Prohibition Act,

1961 against the petitioner herein and five others on the basis

of the first information dated 22.10.2023 received from

Smt.Kalavathi mother of deceased Vinutha.

 4. During the course of investigation, petitioner was

arrested on 23.10.2023 and remanded to judicial custody. Bail

application filed by the petitioner before the jurisdictional

 -3-

 NC: 2024:KHC:29916

 CRL.P No. 3155 of 2024

Sessions Court in Crl.Misc.No.1640/2023 was dismissed on

10.11.2023. Therefore, he had approached this Court in

Crl.P.No.12113/2023. The said criminal petition was dismissed

as withdrawn with liberty to the petitioner to file fresh petition

after charge sheet is filed. Hence, petitioner is before this

Court in this successive bail application, after filing of charge

sheet.

 5. Learned Counsel for the petitioner submits that

though F.I.R. was registered for the offences punishable under

143, 147, 498-A, 302, 304B, 149 of 
IPC
 and 
Sections 3
 & 
4
 of

Dowry Prohibition Act, 1961, charge sheet is now filed for the

offences punishable under 
Sections 498A
, 
304B
 IPC and

Sections 3
 & 
4
 of Dowry Prohibition Act, 1961. He submits that

accused Nos.2 to 5 are already on bail in the present case.

Petitioner has no criminal antecedents and he is in custody for

the last ten months. Accordingly, he prays to allow the petition.

 6. Per contra, learned HCGP has opposed the bail

petition and submits that, death has occurred within a span of

one year from the date of marriage. Therefore, there is a

presumption as against the accused persons. In the first

 -4-

 NC: 2024:KHC:29916

 CRL.P No. 3155 of 2024

information, there are allegations with regard to the

harassment of the deceased and she was being abused and

assaulted in her matrimonial house. He accordingly, prays to

dismiss the petition.

 7. Marriage of the deceased - daughter of the first

informant was solemnized with the petitioner herein on

27.01.2023. In the first information, it is alleged that at the

time of marriage as per the demand made by the accused, the

family members of deceased had given dowry and inspite of the

same, there was demand for payment of additional dowry and

in this background Vinutha was harassed in her matrimonial

house. It is alleged in the first information that petitioner

herein had assaulted Vinutha with sickle on her head, but no

compliant was lodged since uncle of the petitioner had assured

that he would advice the petitioner. The dead body of

deceased-Vinutha was found in a lake in Chelur, Tumakuru

District. On the basis of the first information submitted, initially

F.I.R. was registered against accused persons invoking 
Sections

302
 and 
304B
 of IPC amongst other offences. After

investigation, charge sheet has been now filed for offence

punishable under 
Sections 498A
 and 
304B
 of IPC and Sections

 -5-

 NC: 2024:KHC:29916

 CRL.P No. 3155 of 2024

3 & 4 of 
Dowry Prohibition Act, 1961
. The offence under

Section 302
 of IPC is dropped in the charge sheet. As per the

postmortem report, death of deceased has occurred as a result

of asphyxia due to drowning. Petitioner who has no criminal

antecedents is in custody from 23.10.2023. Undisputedly all

the other accused are already enlarged on bail. Allegations

against the petitioner is required to be proved in a full fledged

trial. Under these circumstances, I am of the view that

petitioner has made out a case for grant of regular bail.

Accordingly, the following:

 ORDER

 The petition is allowed.

 The petitioner is directed to be enlarged on bail in

S.C.No.57/2024 pending before the I Additional District and

Sessions Judge, Tumakuru arising out of Crime No.147/2023

registered by Chelur Police Station, Tumakuru for the offences

punishable under 
Sections 498-A
, 
304-B
 of IPC and 
Sections 3

and 
4
 of Dowry Prohibition Act, 1961 subject to the following

conditions:

 -6-

 NC: 2024:KHC:29916

 CRL.P No. 3155 of 2024

 a) The petitioner shall execute a personal
 bond for a sum of Rs.1,00,000 (Rupees One
 Lakh only) with two sureties for the likesum, to
 the satisfaction of the jurisdictional Court;

 b) The petitioner shall appear regularly on all
 the dates of hearing before the Trial Court
 unless the Trial Court exempts his appearance
 for valid reasons;

 c) The petitioner shall not directly or
 indirectly threaten or tamper with the
 prosecution witnesses;

 d) The petitioner shall not leave the
 jurisdiction of the Trial Court without
 permission of the said Court until the case
 registered against him is disposed off.

 e) The petitioner shall not involve in similar
 offences in future.

 Sd/-

 (S VISHWAJITH SHETTY)
 JUDGE

GPG

List No.: 1 Sl No.: 33

CT: BHK

 CRIMINAL PETITION NO. 3155 OF 2024
 BETWEEN:

RAVEESHA,
 S/O SHIVARUDRAIAH, 32 YEARS,

 NITTUR HOBLI, GUBBI TALUK,

AND:

STATE OF KARNATAKA BY

THIS CRL.P IS FILED U/S 439 OF CR.PC PRAYING TO

 REGISTERED BY CHELUR P.S., TUMAKURU FOR THE OFFENCE

IPC

 PENDING ON THE FILE OF THE PRL. CIVIL JUDGE (JR.DN) AND
 J.M.F.C COURT GUBBI TUMAKURU DISTRICT IN
 C.C.NO.27/2024.

THIS PETITION, COMING ON FOR ORDERS, THIS DAY,

 -2-
 NC: 2024:KHC:29916
 CRL.P No. 3155 of 2024

CORAM: HON'BLE MR JUSTICE S VISHWAJITH SHETTY
 ORAL ORDER
Accused No.1 in S.C.No.57/2024 pending before the
Court of I Additional District and Sessions Judge, Tumakuru,
arising out of Crime No.147/2023 registered by Chelur Police
Station, Tumakuru District, for the offences punishable under

Sections 498-A
, 
304-B
 of IPC and 
Sections 3
 & 
4
 of Dowry

Prohibition Act, 1961, is before this Court under 
Section 439
 of
Cr.P.C.
2. Heard the learned counsel for the parties.
3. F.I.R. in Crime No.147/2023 was registered by
Chelur Police Station, Tumakuru District, initially for the

offences punishable under 
Sections 143
, 
147
, 
498-A
, 
302
,

304B
, 
149
 of IPC and 
Sections 3
 & 
4
 of Dowry Prohibition Act,
1961 against the petitioner herein and five others on the basis
of the first information dated 22.10.2023 received from
Smt.Kalavathi mother of deceased Vinutha.
4. During the course of investigation, petitioner was
arrested on 23.10.2023 and remanded to judicial custody. Bail
application filed by the petitioner before the jurisdictional
CRL.P No. 3155 of 2024
Sessions Court in Crl.Misc.No.1640/2023 was dismissed on
10.11.2023. Therefore, he had approached this Court in
Crl.P.No.12113/2023. The said criminal petition was dismissed
as withdrawn with liberty to the petitioner to file fresh petition
after charge sheet is filed. Hence, petitioner is before this
Court in this successive bail application, after filing of charge
sheet.
5. Learned Counsel for the petitioner submits that
though F.I.R. was registered for the offences punishable under

143, 147, 498-A, 302, 304B, 149 of 
IPC
 and 
Sections 3
 & 
4
 of
Dowry Prohibition Act, 1961, charge sheet is now filed for the

offences punishable under 
Sections 498A
, 
304B
 IPC and

Sections 3
 & 
4
 of Dowry Prohibition Act, 1961. He submits that
accused Nos.2 to 5 are already on bail in the present case.
Petitioner has no criminal antecedents and he is in custody for
the last ten months. Accordingly, he prays to allow the petition.
6. Per contra, learned HCGP has opposed the bail
petition and submits that, death has occurred within a span of
one year from the date of marriage. Therefore, there is a
presumption as against the accused persons. In the first
CRL.P No. 3155 of 2024
information, there are allegations with regard to the
harassment of the deceased and she was being abused and
assaulted in her matrimonial house. He accordingly, prays to
dismiss the petition.
7. Marriage of the deceased - daughter of the first
informant was solemnized with the petitioner herein on
27.01.2023. In the first information, it is alleged that at the
time of marriage as per the demand made by the accused, the
family members of deceased had given dowry and inspite of the
same, there was demand for payment of additional dowry and
in this background Vinutha was harassed in her matrimonial
house. It is alleged in the first information that petitioner
herein had assaulted Vinutha with sickle on her head, but no
compliant was lodged since uncle of the petitioner had assured
that he would advice the petitioner. The dead body of
deceased-Vinutha was found in a lake in Chelur, Tumakuru
District. On the basis of the first information submitted, initially

F.I.R. was registered against accused persons invoking 
Sections

302
 and 
304B
 of IPC amongst other offences. After
investigation, charge sheet has been now filed for offence

punishable under 
Sections 498A
 and 
304B
 of IPC and Sections
CRL.P No. 3155 of 2024

3 & 4 of 
Dowry Prohibition Act, 1961
. The offence under

Section 302
 of IPC is dropped in the charge sheet. As per the
postmortem report, death of deceased has occurred as a result
of asphyxia due to drowning. Petitioner who has no criminal
antecedents is in custody from 23.10.2023. Undisputedly all
the other accused are already enlarged on bail. Allegations
against the petitioner is required to be proved in a full fledged
trial. Under these circumstances, I am of the view that
petitioner has made out a case for grant of regular bail.
Accordingly, the following:
ORDER
The petition is allowed.
The petitioner is directed to be enlarged on bail in
S.C.No.57/2024 pending before the I Additional District and
Sessions Judge, Tumakuru arising out of Crime No.147/2023
registered by Chelur Police Station, Tumakuru for the offences

punishable under 
Sections 498-A
, 
304-B
 of IPC and 
Sections 3

and 
4
 of Dowry Prohibition Act, 1961 subject to the following
conditions:
CRL.P No. 3155 of 2024

a) The petitioner shall execute a personal
 bond for a sum of Rs.1,00,000 (Rupees One
 Lakh only) with two sureties for the likesum, to
 the satisfaction of the jurisdictional Court;

b) The petitioner shall appear regularly on all
 the dates of hearing before the Trial Court
 unless the Trial Court exempts his appearance
 for valid reasons;

d) The petitioner shall not leave the
 jurisdiction of the Trial Court without
 permission of the said Court until the case
 registered against him is disposed off.

e) The petitioner shall not involve in similar
 offences in future.
Sd/-

(S VISHWAJITH SHETTY)
 JUDGE
GPG

suggested_precedents.full_citation: Bachan Singh v. State of Punjab, (1980) 2 SCC 684
suggested_precedents.legal_principle: Death penalty - rarest of rare doctrine

suggested_precedents.full_citation: Arnesh Kumar v. State of Bihar, (2014) 8 SCC 273
suggested_precedents.legal_principle: Mandatory arrest not required for offences punishable less than 7 years
